▿ Step
  ResponseEnded

▿ Request
  GET http://localhost:8080/episodes?tag=Server-Side%20Swift
  Authorization: Basic aGVsbG86d29ybGQ=

  (Data, 0 bytes)

▿ Response
  Status 200 OK
  Content-Length: 33000
  Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf8

style="width:100%;max-height:200px;object-fit:cover"></a></div></div><div class=" col col-xs-8"><div><strong class="h6 caps lh-1">Episode 4</strong><h5 class="fg-black bold h3 lh-2"><a href="/episodes/ep4-type-safe-html-in-swift">Type-Safe HTML in Swift</a></h5><p class="body-leading fg-black regular lh-4">As server-side Swift becomes more popular and widely adopted, it will be important to re-examine some of the past “best-practices” of web frameworks to see how Swift’s type system can improve upon them.</p><div><ol class="inline-block list-reset"><li class="inline-block m-mr1 m-mb1"><a href="/episodes?tag=DSL" class="h6 m-pt1 m-pb1 m-pl2 m-pr2 pill border bg-white text-decoration-none border-gray-900">DSL</a></li><li class="inline-block m-mr1 m-mb1"><a Swift</a></li></ol></div></div></div></div></li></ul></div></div><div class="xs-hide sm-hide col col-md-3"><div class="m-pt3 m-pr4 m-pb2 sticky-md top-0"><h5 class="fg-black bold h6 lh-1 caps">Sort
